4.2 Safeguards

4.2.1 No Net Harm

The detailed environmental impact assessment was submitted to the Direction of Environment in February 2015 and approved by ANDE decree n°0078 of August 21st, 2015.

As of the latest update of the project’s Environmental and Social Management Plan (PGES, September 2019), its overall progress has exceeded 60% completion with on the one hand, the protection of biodiversity is effective with the creation of the a dedicated area of more than 200ha and the preservation of fauna and flora species, and on the other hand, the implementation of the development plan for the fishing industry in Soubré with, in particular, the training of aspiring fishermen, the organisation of the sector in Soubré and the start of construction work on the infrastructure.

The Resettlement Action Plan (PAR) has achieved its objectives with the restoration of impacted people's livelihoods. The construction of the resettlement sites with all the amenities of the urban areas and population displacements ended in 2018. Purge compensations of customary rights and destruction of agricultural crops have been carried out for all areas impacted by the dam.
